meanings.definition: To trim off the outer covering or excess parts of something.
meanings.sent1: She pares the apple skin carefully.
meanings.sent2: He pares the nails to keep them short.
meanings.sent3: The chef pares the vegetables with precision.
meanings.sent4: Time pares away the unnecessary worries.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor pares the marble to reveal the hidden beauty.

meanings.sent1: He pares down his expenses to save money.
meanings.sent2: The company pares its workforce during tough times.
meanings.sent3: The sun pares the snow on the mountain slopes.
meanings.sent4: Laughter pares away the sadness in her heart.
meanings.sent5: Each step pares down the distance to the finish line.

meanings.definition: To cut away the outer covering or surface of something.
meanings.sent1: She pares the rough edges of the paper.
meanings.sent2: He pares the bark off the tree trunk.
meanings.sent3: The gardener pares the dead leaves from the plant.
meanings.sent4: The artist pares the canvas to start anew.
meanings.sent5: The knife pares the skin off the potato smoothly.
